trial_identification.studytitle: Study of beta2-Microglobulin Removal by Standard Versus New High Cut-Off Haemodialysis Membrane
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomised, Cross Over Pilot Study Comparing Removal of beta2-Microglobulin by Standard Haemodialysis to Haemodialysis With a Novel Dialysis Membrane (P2SH) in Chronic Dialysis Patients

interventions.interventions:
Other interventions - Larger pore haemodialysis membrane Other interventions - Standard haemodialysis membrane
Experimental: A - New larger pore membrane
Active Comparator: B - Standard haemodialysis membrane
Other interventions: Larger pore haemodialysis membrane Patients receive haemodialysis sessions 3 times a week. They are randomized to start with either treatment A (experimental arm) or treatment B (active comparator arm) and continue for 2 weeks, followed by a 1-week washout period. The patients then cross-over and receive the other treatment (either B or A) for 2 weeks.
Other interventions: Standard haemodialysis membrane Patients receive haemodialysis sessions 3 times a week. They are randomized to start with either treatment A (experimental arm) or treatment B (active comparator arm) and continue for 2 weeks, followed by a 1-week washout period. The patients then cross-over and receive the other treatment (either B or A) for 2 weeks.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Beta2-microglobulin removal by new larger pore membrane versus standard haemodialysis membrane
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 5 weeks (2 weeks in each arm, 1-week washout period)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Albumin loss with the use of new larger pore membrane compared with standard haemodialysis membrane
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 5 weeks (2 weeks in each arm, 1-week washout period)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Removal of low-molecular-weight solutes by new larger pore membrane versus standard haemodialysis membrane
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 5 weeks (2 weeks in each arm; 1-week washout period)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Chronic haemodialysis patients for more than 2 years
- Urine output <100 mL per day
- 3 haemodialysis sessions per week
- Permanent arteriovenous dialysis access

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a novel haemodialysis membrane, compared with the standard dialysis membrane, will increase the removal of beta2-microglobulin in chronic dialysis patients.

contact.name: Rinaldo Bellomo, MBBS,MD,FRACP
contact.address: Director Intensive Care Research, Austin Health
